column2: MARYLAND DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Maryland

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The road is the most slippery:
column4: after it rains.
column6: when it first starts to rain.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 2. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 3. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Side road
column6: Side road entering from the left
column8: Yield sign ahead

column2: 5. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Only right turns are allowed.

column2: 6. Driver distractions include:
column4: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.
column8: Slowing down to look at crash scene.

column2: 7. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 8. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Law
column8: Suggestions

column2: 9. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.
column6: there are more cars on the roads at night.
column8: the speed limit is increased at night.

column2: 10. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: On the right curb.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way
column8: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear

column2: 12. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column6: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.
column8: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.

column2: 13. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: white rectangles.
column8: white triangles.

column2: 14. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column6: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.
column8: it draws the attention of other drivers.

column2: 15. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column4: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.
column8: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.

column2: 16. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Merging traffic
column8: Watch for trucks entering from the side

column2: 18. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Diamond
column8: Pennant

column2: 19. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.

column2: 20. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Reduction in lanes
column8: Stop sign ahead

column2: 22. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 23. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 24. Stopping distances:
column4: are not affected by vehicle speed.
column8: decrease as vehicle speed increases.

column2: 25. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
